channel.title: Nbc on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Nbc on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Solved
item.description: More than 30 years ago, onetime Eliot Ness stand-in Robert Stack found a way to embellish his legacy in the modern era. The solution was through a show named Unsolved Mysteries, one of the first reality-based shows of the modern era, mixing scripted plots with true stories. First appearing as a special in 1987, it became a full-fledged series not long after the success of a similar program, America’s Most Wanted on Fox.

item.title: The Game Of Life
item.description: There isn’t a better explanation for the current state of the American psyche than the impressive success of The Wall, which just had its season finale last night. It has a name that evokes a certain political football without ever actually referencing it. It counts perhaps the world’s most famous basketball player as an executive producer. It counts perhaps the busiest man in the world— the CEO of a freaking media empire—as its host.
